name: Holiday Inn Express Liverpool Hoylake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live locally so didn't stay here, but I took my daughter for lunch here last week to try out this brand new restaurant and enjoyed it so much, I went back with my husband on Saturday night. When we tried to book they didn't have any availability but took our number to get back to us if they could fit us in. They phoned back twice; firstly to offer us a time which we couldn't do, then secondly to offer us a different time due to a cancellation. We were very impressed with their efforts to accommodate us. When we arrived we were greeted by a very pleasant young lady who sat us in comfortable seats where we were served with our first drinks. We sat and enjoyed the surroundings of the stylish restaurant which had a lovely buzzy atmosphere. The staff were all smartly dressed and very polite and helpful. Our meals were beautifully cooked and presented . We both had steak and some delicious side orders and my husband finished off his meal with a home made tiramisu which was lovely. We will definitely return as we were impressed with the whole experience and look forward to a few return visits.
reviews.title: Lovely new restaurant.

reviews.text: We stayed at the new Holiday Inn Express, Hoylake over the Bank Holiday weekend, the hotel is new and very clean. The bar area was a little soulless but there is a restaurant next door and a few bars in the area. It is a short walk to the beach which was popular with dog walkers, not much else there though there are a few shops in Hoylake.
reviews.title: Room with a View ?

reviews.text: The rate included breakfast which was okay, hot selection was sausage (not good quality), scrambled egg and beans. Orange juice was more like squash and the coffee was a little watery.
reviews.title: Suberb brand new hotel and beautiful Marco Pierre White restaurant.
Frankie's is great!
reviews.text: My main issue was that I booked the room online weeks ago and requested a high room with a view, as you can see from the picture the view was a was with some vents ! It also was on the middle floor with subsequent noise from above. We should have complained but as we were only staying for a night it didn't seem worth the trip back to reception. Probably more an issue with the online booking system as we were also on a late checkout rate which no-one on reception seemed sure about.

We also ate at the new Frankies restaurant next door which was above average, but a little overpriced £9.50 for a margarita pizza and the cheapest wine was £19, luke warm chips. Also when we went to check our booking on arrival we were told about a sharing menu they did on a Sunday this look good but they failed to mention it was only until 5pm and our booking was at 6:30pm.
reviews.title: Frankies

reviews.text: I live nearby so have not stayed in the hotel but ate at Frankies last night and the food was lovely. The staff are all very helpful and the restaurant itself is really nice. My only criticism is that the choice of starters is poor and they either need to add more or have a specials board. That aside, we will definately be visiting again in the near future and it is great to have another restaurant in Hoylake.
reviews.title: Frankies is lovely!

reviews.text: Stayed for business trip on the Wirral, the Holiday inn Express has only been open for a week or so subsequently everything was spotless, the booking inn reception and bar are together so with only one person working she was pretty busy when we checked in. Rooms were of high standard however typical Express with little or no storage facilities.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: We ate at Frankies which is attached (Frankie Dettori & Marco Pierre White) had an enjoyable meal but nothing outstanding, it was very busy on a Wednesday night so I would probably recommend booking a table.
reviews.title: mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm NICE :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been eagerly awaiting a visit to Frankie's since it opened and generally speaking we weren't disappointed. The restaurant was buzzing but despite this the service was speedy and attentive. A query about a dish on the menu was answered promptly, indicating staff have been well trained. We both had a different version of the mozzarella starter and it was of a generous proportion, although my avocado was quite firm. I wanted a rib-eye steak for main but they had none left so I went for the lasagne instead which was an extremely generous portion. It was a tad dry but I took that to mean the meat was better quality and not fatty. My wife had a chicken main which she enjoyed. No room left for desserts but they looked tempting. We did think the wine was a tad pricey at almost £20 for the cheapest bottle so went for a drink each instead. Total bill was just under £40. We will be returning, particularly as it had a decent atmosphere which is missing at some other restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: Frankie's is a decent new addition to Hoylake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I ate at Frankies last night. Service from bar staff and waitresses was pleasant. Starters were ok but nothing outstanding. Mozzarella and tomato and ceaser salad, simple to prepare, presentation ok ingredients ok.
reviews.title: Mixed food quality

reviews.text: I had a burger for main which I thought was nice. Other half ordered spaghetti with basil and pesto. This consisted of a ball of grey ish looking spaghetti with a very light coating of something they passed of as pesto, with two basil leaves on top. Looked extremely unimpressive and tasted of nothing. Extremely disappointing and wife did not eat it.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.text: Didn't want to make fuss so food was just left uneaten. Waitress noticed and we had the pleasure of a discussion on the food with the manger.
reviews.title: Hoylake Holiday Inn

reviews.text: Unfortunately his view was that this was a set recipe and usually this dish was well received. Fair enough but I can't really believe that people would want to eat this as I tasted it and it was rubbish. A jar from Sainsburys with some toasted pine nuts and some Parmesan shavings would have been infinitely better.
reviews.title: Excellent

description: This new build 56 bedroom hotel gives you something unique;a mix of cosmopolitan, blending with the original VictorianHouse which will house our fabulous Marco Pierre WhiteFrankies New York Italian, bedrooms and meeting rooms.The supporting infrastructure offers an eclectic mix ofrural, urban and coastal activity from sailing at the seasidetown of West Kirby to playing golf at the neighbouringRoyal Liverpool Golf Club, home to the Open Golfchampionship in 2014 following its success in 2008, tosightseeing, shopping and exploring the City of Liverpool,hailed as the best European Capital of Culture on record,also ideally placed to visit the Historical City of Chester.
